meanings.definition: Unable to be endured or tolerated.
meanings.sent1: The unbearable heat made everyone seek shade.
meanings.sent2: The long wait in line was unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The unbearable noise of the construction site kept me up all night.
meanings.sent4: The unbearable weight of the backpack felt like a ton of bricks on my shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The unbearable smell from the garbage bin made me gag.

meanings.definition: To endure or tolerate something unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: I can barely unbear the thought of losing my favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: She had to unbear the pain of a broken heart.
meanings.sent3: He tried to unbear the spicy food, but it was too much for him.
meanings.sent4: They had to unbear the storm until help arrived.
meanings.sent5: We must unbear the challenges that come our way with courage.
